author: SARAH SCHMALBRUCH
title: Photographer recreates grandfather's 40-year-old snapshots
text:
Photographer recreates grandfather's 40-year-old snapshots SARAH SCHMALBRUCH Last updated 13:04, October 15 2015 Christian Carollo/Instagram 
Photographer Christian Carollo travels around the United States following in the footsteps of his late grandfather. 
Christian Carollo's grandfather was an avid traveller - now the photographer is following in his footsteps - literally. 
Carollo's grandfather documented all of his travels with his camera, which is how Carollo ended up with about 30 boxes of photo slides when his grandfather passed away in 2008. 
After rifling through one of the boxes, Carollo came up with the idea of trying to recreate his grandfather's photos during his own travels, calling it the past present project . Jun 26, 2015 at 4:50pm PDT 
Muir Woods National Monument in Marin County, California | April 1979 & May 2015 Jun 22, 2015 at 12:26pm PDT 
Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans, Louisiana | February 1978 & April 2014 May 24, 2015 at 6:39pm PDT 
Valhalla Pier in South Lake Tahoe, California | June 1981 & May 2015 Sep 23, 2015 at 4:50pm PDT 
Golden Spike National Historic Site in Promontory Summit, Utah | September 1974 & September 2015 A photo posted by Christian Carollo (@sayhellotoamerica) on Aug 4, 2015 at 5:02pm PDT 
As he travels around the United States, Carollo takes a picture in each of the places his grandfather had once been. 
The images show just how much - or little - the places have changed in the last 40-years. 
The recreated photos have been posted to both Instagram and Facebook .
